Package aom.scripting.ui.console

Class Console

Object
Console
public abstract class Console
extends Object
This class provides a collection of Console commands that don't fit in any of the subcategories.
Author:
Mythic_Freak - mythic.freak[a]gmail.com
Editor Mode Only
[@editor Some console commands only run in editor mode. Use the following template to make them work: 
 subModeEnter("Simulation", "Editor");
 //your editor command here;
 subModeLeave("Simulation", "Editor");
 modeEnter("pregame");
 modeEnter("Simulation");
 subModeEnter("Simulation", "Singleplayer");
]

  • Method Details

    • map

      public void map​(string key, string context, string command)
      Maps an input event to the given command, in the given context.
      Parameters:
      key - The input key to be bound to an action. When prefixed with a plus, the given action is executed on both keydown and keyup, with param keyState 0 and 1 respectively.
      context -

      General contexts:

      • root
      • developer (needs +developer flag in user.cfg)
      • aiDebug (needs +aiDebug flag in user.cfg)
      • pregame
      • world (everything with a map in it, i.e. game + editor)
      • game
      • postgame
      • editor
      • strategicmap (the big map when you press tab in AoT)
      • console
      • XSDebugger
      • arena //weird campaign menu
      • AILocSelect

      Building contexts:

      • buildAccel
      • settlementAccel
      • dockAccel
      • marketAccel
      • greekAcademyAccel
      • greekArcheryRangeAccel
      • greekStableAccel
      • greekFortressAccel
      • egyptBarracksAccel
      • egyptMigdolAccel
      • egyptSiegeCampAccel
      • norseLongHouseAccel
      • norseFortAccel
      • atlanteanBarracksAccel
      • atlanteanCounterAccel
      • atlanteanPalaceAccel
      • templeGreekAccel
      • templeEgyptianAccel
      • templeNorseAccel
      • templeAtlanteanAccel

      Gadgets: all gadget names can be used as context, but may only execute if the mapping is defined in the same file as the gadget (e.g. in uimain.xml).

      • detailHelp
      • fakeTechTree
      • objectives
      • chatDialog
      • tributeDialog
      • playerStatusDialog
      • mainGameMenu

      All Edit Modes

      command - Any sequence of functions found in this package. There is a rather short length limit on this parameter. This limitation does not apply to keys bound in the data/DefaultKeyMap.xml file or commands in e.g. UI buttons.
      Local Call
      [@local ]
      See Also:
      InputConfig.allowMultipleBinds, editMode(string), uiEnterContext(string), uiLeaveContext(string), ScriptConfig.developer, ScriptConfig.aiDebug
      Example
      map("control-shift-alt-F12", "root", "configToggle(\"flashHitpointBarsOnDamage\")")

    • console

      public void console()
      Toggles the state of the console dialog. Only works with a preceding configSet(\"showConsole\") call.
      Local Call
      [@local ]
      See Also:

      public void resourceMarket​(int playerID, string resourceTo, float amount, string resourceFrom)

      public void uiMessageBox​(string text, string command)

      Parameters:

      command - The command to execute when the OK button is pressed.
      Local Call
      [@local ]
      Note
      This method can act as an eval(string command).

    • uiAgeUpDialog

      public void uiAgeUpDialog​(string techName)
      Brings up the age advancement dialog with a suitable set of minor god choices. A techName="Age 2 Fake" seems to work fine for all ages. I have not yet been able to automatically choose 1 of the 2 minor gods through the console.
      Local Call
      [@local Once a minor god is chosen reseachByID will probably be called, which will sync your choice with other computers.]
      See Also:

      [@local ]

    • minimapRotateMode

      public void minimapRotateMode​(int mode)
      Changes the minimap rotation mode. No arguments means toggle. In mode A, the minimap is fixed and won't rotate. Instead, the camera box inside it will rotate. In mode B, the minimap is as you all know it.
      Local Call
      [@local ]
      Note
      This command only seems to toggle the mode. Directly setting is does not seem to work anymore.
